title: 109_s3782
content: The Act titled "Hurricane and Flood Protection Tax Credit Act" provides a credit for expenses incurred in hurricane or flood protection projects under section 30D of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The "Hurricane and Flood Protection Tax Credit Act" allows a 30 percent tax credit for qualified expenditures on unfunded authorized projects, limited by the taxpayer's regular tax liability and other applicable credits. The "Hurricane and Flood Protection Tax Credit Act" allows a 30 percent tax credit for qualified expenditures on unfunded authorized projects for hurricane or flood protection in the United States, subject to approval by the Federal agency administering the project and proportional allocation of funds. The "Hurricane and Flood Protection Tax Credit Act" allows a 30 percent tax credit for qualified expenditures on unfunded authorized projects for hurricane or flood protection in the United States, with provisions for carryovers of excess credit amounts. The rules of section 39 apply with modifications, including extending the taxable years for certain provisions. Special rules include basis reduction for certain properties. Special rules under section 39 include basis reduction for properties eligible for the credit, no double benefit for deductions or credits, and reduction for any assistance received by the taxpayer. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include a basis adjustment in section 1016(a) and a new item in the table of sections for subpart B of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 related to section 30D(e)(1). The amendments made by this section apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2005.
